title: Why is the background music louder than the dialogue? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m not sure what example you are referring to since there is no link, but odds are whoever mixed it didn’t listen to the mix on multiple outlets before releasing it. If you are referring to a movie in a theater, the theater might have the speakers turned up wrong. Often there is a standard level for each channel, but if it was set up wrong, it can affect the overall sound. If it’s a YouTube video or something similar, the person mixing it probably used headphones, or mixed in a bad environment and didn’t get a good sense of the environment.
i don’t really know what you ask about
